    Utilities for address auto complete/auto fill.
    AddressBookMatch
    This is a special interface that is used by the ContactMatchWorksheet in the processes of creating a contact in addressbook or when linking a contact to the addressbook. It is a common interface of both {@link com.guidewire.pl.domain.contact.PotentialMatches} and {@link com.guidewire.pl.domain.contact.DefinitiveMatch}.
    AddressBookUtil
    Static methods for use by the UI to manage the addressbook (and the ContactSearchAdapter). With this class the UI can update, delele, add, link and sync contacts.

    AutocompleteResult
    Holds an autocomplete suggestion, typically displayed in a dropdown below the field when the user has entered the first few characters of a field value.
    AutofillRequest  
    ContactAutoSyncUtil
    A utility class for all Contact Auto Sync functions. The actual implementation for the auto sync functionality should be here so that gosu API can call into here.
    ContactAutoSyncUtilBase

    ContactEmailAutocompleteHandler  
    ContactHandle
    Introduces a level of indirection to a Contact. This is required to support Contact syncing. When a Contact is synced, it is sometimes replaced with a new Java object. This happens if the Contact needs to be {@link gw.pl.persistence.core.entity.KeyableBean#downcast(gw.entity.IEntityType) downcasted}. If this happens, all existing references to the old Java object will become invalid. So, any shared sections which take a Contact should take a ContactHandle instead, so that they always get the latest, non-stale version of the Contact.
    ContactLifecycle  
    ContactLifecycleImpl  
    ContactMinimalTags  
    ContactMinimalTagsImpl  
    ContactSubtypeSpecificException  
    ContactTemplateHelper  
    ContactTokenThreadLocal
    DrivingDirections
    Contains directions for driving between a pair of addresses, as well as the total driving distance and estimated total driving time. The detailed directions are provided as an array of DrivingDirectionsElem.

    If provided by the Geocoding service used, a set of maps representing the detailed directions is provided as an array of MapImageUrls. Note that there is no direct mapping between the the size of the DrivingDirectionsElem array and the size of the MapImageUrls; maps may represent either individual stages or multiple stages.

    {@link gw.api.contact.DrivingDirectionsElem}
    {@link gw.api.contact.MapImageUrl}]]>
    DrivingDirectionsCache
    DrivingDirectionsElem
    DrivingDirectionsElem One element of a set of driving directions

    This may represent either a discrete stage in the directions ("Turn left onto I-80 for 10 miles") or a note or milestone not corresponding to a stage ("Start trip".)

    The exact format and content of the textual description depends greatly on the Geocoding service used; in particular, it may or may not include HTML formatting.

    {@link DrivingDirections}
    ExternalContact
    Represents a contact that is managed by an external source. An External Source of contacts can be either the AddressBookPlugin or a ContactSearchAdapter.
    ExternalContactSource
    PCF interface to an external Contact source. An external contact source can be either the {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.addressbook.AddressBookContactSourceImpl Address Book} or a {@link com.guidewire.pl.web.addressbook.ContactSearchAdapterContactSourceImpl ContactSearchAdapter}.
    LinkStatus
    Represents the status of a Contact with respect to the Address Book. The possible {@link com.guidewire.pl.domain.contact.ContactLinkStatus} enum values are: UNLINKED BROKEN Linked but the contact was not found in the Address Book. NOT_SYNCED Linked but not in sync because the remote contact has changed. The local contact might or might not have changed since last sync. SYNCED_REMOTE Linked but not in sync because the local contact has changed. The remote contact has not changed since the last sync. Compare the local and remote contact to see if key match fields were changed to prevent overwriting the remote contact in error. SYNCED UNKNOWN An Address Book error occurred.
    LocationContactHandle
    Implementation of {@link ContactHandle} for use as a Location variable.
    MapImageUrl
    MapImageUrl The URL where an image of a map can be found. A set of MapImageUrl entities will be associated with a given DrivingDirections entity if a Geocoding service supports mapping.

    {@link com.guidewire.pl.domain.contact.DrivingDirections}]]>
    NewContactUtil
    This is a UI helper class to help create a new Contact object of a given subtype.
    ProximitySearchPageHelper
    Helper for Address Book pages and provides session-specific utility functions for pages which need proximity search functionality. This includes some pages not in the Address Book tab, such as those used for Admin and Assignment User searches.
    ProximitySearchPageHelper.ProximitySearchParameterHelper  
    TemporaryContact
    Holds a reference to a temporary Contact. Used to pass a temporary Contact to a Location. This extra level of indirection is necessary, because normally, when a bean is passed to a Location, it is added to that Location's bundle. Unfortunately, adding a bean to a bundle just adds that bean, not any sub-objects hanging off that bean. Normally, this is OK, but when those sub-objects are temporary objects, then you wind up with a bean in the Location bundle that has dangling references. Typical usage is to wrap a Contact in a TemporaryContact and pass that to a Location. Then, at some point in the future, within the Location, invoke code that copies the entire Contact graph into the Location's bundle.
    TooLooseContactCreateCriteriaException
    An exception thrown when an ABContact lacks required information for creation. The exception message depends on the ABContact's subtype and a specified country. Please see the displaykeys that begin with "Java.TooLooseContactCreateCriteriaException." to see how subtypes and countries map to specific displaykeys.
    TooLooseContactDuplicateMatchCriteriaException
    An exception thrown when an ABContact lacks required information for finding duplicates. The exception message depends on the ABContact's subtype and a specified country. Please see the displaykeys that begin with "Java.TooLooseContactDuplicateMatchCriteriaException." to see how subtypes and countries map to specific displaykeys.
    TooLooseContactSearchCriteriaException
    An exception thrown when an ABContact lacks required information for searching. Throwing such an exception can help ensure the performance of search features.

    The exception message depends on the ABContact's subtype and a specified country. Please see the displaykeys that begin with "Java.TooLooseContactSearchCriteriaException." to see how subtypes and countries map to specific displaykeys.
